results.title: Creatures in clay: ceramic sculpture by Rosemary Wren
results.creator_credit: Films for Potters and J M Anderson Films
results.brief_description: This film about pottery shows in some detail, Rosemary Wren’s technique of building large figures, using T-shaped coils, and making small models by thumbing and pinching.

results.title: Creativity at school
results.brief_description: High school students learn to think creatively in a Technical Activities Centre where they apply what they have learned to model building projects. An experiment in science education at Sevenoaks School in Kent; boys apply the principals learned to creating a variety of models, instruments and machines including wireless controlled model boats and racing cars, an instrument to give blind people signals about their physical environment and a simple computer. The nature of this experiment makes this film an important educational record.

results.title: The Creation of the world
results.brief_description: Marcel Marceau performs one of his “Pantomimes”, this one dealing with the creation of the world. The film captures the beauty and meaning of the art of mime by one of the world’s masters of this ancient art.

results.title: Creating with shapes
results.creator_credit: Dick Larson and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Objects in nature, man-made objects, children’s art, and famous paintings introduce the three basic shapes: rectangles, triangles and circles. After learning to observe shapes, we see children creating and arranging shapes to form original works of art.

results.title: Creating with clay
results.brief_description: A teacher demonstrates wire and spiral wedging using nylon to string to divide clay. Students create spontaneously - pinch bowls, coil pot, slab draping and decorating, fist forms, texturing and string sculpture.
results.description: A teacher demonstrates wire and spiral wedging using nylon to string to divide clay. Students create spontaneously - pinch bowls, coil pot, slab draping and decorating, fist forms, texturing and string sculpture.

results.title: Creating a dance (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The first part of the film traces stages in the creation of a demonstration of dance movement, examining the constituent parts and illustrating how the solutions to some of the associated problems were evolved. The second part presents the entire demonstration without comment. Dance direction and narration by Valerie Preston-Dunlop.

results.title: Crayon
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the wide techniques which may be used in working with crayons - notching, scratching, rubbing, grating and melting. Drawing can be on paper, wood, metal, glass and fabric. Shows artists creating brilliantly coloured and textures work.

results.title: Cray season
results.creator_credit: Rodney Musch, Don Anderson and Tasmanian State Film Unit
results.brief_description: The crayfish, seen not as a table delicacy, but as a living creature whose survival is threatened. Briefly looks at its life history, its vulnerability, its predators, and man its greatest enemy. Feild researchers take the camera underwater to the world of ‘Janus Lalander’, the southern crayfish.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rodney Musch, Don Anderson and Tasmanian State Film Unit

results.title: The Crawl
results.brief_description: A detailed study of the various movements necessary for the perfection of the crawl stroke in swimming, including regulation of breathing, and leg and arm action. Underwater and slow-motion photography are used extensively.

results.title: Crane Island
results.creator_credit: Raymond Garceau, Leonard Frost and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A visit to one of the many tiny islands in the St. Lawrence River. Flocks of snow geese and other migratory birds, annually attract hundreds of sportsmen. Accompanies a party of visiting hunters as they bring down a plentiful bag. Shows the daily life of the French Canadian inhabitants who find a hardy but wholesome existence on the island’s bountiful lowland.
